6_use_cases.title: Second Brain via text message
6_use_cases.description: Text your bot from Telegram, iMessage, or Discord: 'remember this', 'save this link', 'book recommendation'. OpenClaw stores it all. Search it instantly.
6_use_cases.example: 'Remind me to read a book about local LLMs' → search 'local LLMs' later to pull up every relevant note

6_use_cases.title: Custom Morning Brief (automatic, daily)
6_use_cases.description: Every morning at 8am, bot sends a personalised report to your phone: biggest AI news overnight, fresh video/content ideas with full scripts, your to-do list for today, and what the agent can do for you today.
6_use_cases.example: Wake up to a Telegram message with your entire day laid out — including tasks your bot can handle while you sleep

6_use_cases.title: Content Factory (multi-agent pipeline)
6_use_cases.description: Three specialised agents in Discord channels: Agent 1 (research) finds trending topics + competitor analysis. Agent 2 (writing) turns best idea into full script. Agent 3 (visuals) generates thumbnails.
6_use_cases.example: Full YouTube video — research, script, thumbnail — produced automatically every morning

6_use_cases.title: Last 30 Days — business research skill
6_use_cases.description: Scans Reddit and X for what people are saying about your topic or industry in the last 30 days. Finds pain points, trending questions, content gaps. Alex credits this to 'Matt Van Horde'.
6_use_cases.note: This skill is already installed in the AgentSorted OpenClaw instance
6_use_cases.example: 'What are SA business owners complaining about on Reddit this month?' → full report in minutes

6_use_cases.title: Automated deal/lead prospecting
6_use_cases.description: Agent proactively scans for new signups, leads, or opportunities and sends personalised follow-up drafts or actual messages.
6_use_cases.example: New signup hits your database → agent drafts personalised outreach → queued for your review

6_use_cases.title: Full site/project rebuild from your phone
6_use_cases.description: Give a high-level instruction like 'migrate my Notion blog to Astro' via Telegram while doing something else. Agent executes entirely — migrating content, updating DNS, pushing to GitHub.
6_use_cases.example: Rebuilt entire site via Telegram while watching Netflix. Notion → Astro, 18 posts migrated, DNS moved. Never opened laptop.

remote_access: Tailscale (secure, free for personal use — access Mac mini from anywhere)

ai_models_cheap.note: Alex has a 'How to Run OpenClaw for Dirt Cheap' YouTube video
ai_models_cheap.strategy: Route tasks by complexity — use Gemini Flash for simple cron jobs, Claude Sonnet for complex tasks, Claude Opus only when needed

security_warnings: Never expose your OpenClaw gateway to the public internet
Use Tailscale for remote access instead of port forwarding
Store API keys in a password manager, not plain text files
VPS setups require extra hardening — one misconfigured port = full exposure
Local Mac mini is inherently more secure than any cloud option
